results.title: [Alternative approaches to treatment of paroxysmal atrial fibrillation].
results.text_hl: The results show that "tablets in the pocket" strategy is the most effective and safe method of treatment of rare episodes of @DISEASE_Atrial_Fibrillation @DISEASE_MESH:D001281 @@@atrial fibrillation@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with mild structural @DISEASE_Heart_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D006331 @@@heart diseases@@@; the terminating effectiveness of propanorm was 79% during hospital treatment and 88% in outpatients in the selected group of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ without a significant number of side effects. Treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ (dapril) was followed by a decrease in the number of paroxysms, duration of @<m>DISEASE_Arrhythmias_Cardiac</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001145 @@@arrhythmia@@@ episodes, and a tendency to transformation into asymptomatic form.

citations.NLM: Tatarskiĭ BA. [Alternative approaches to treatment of paroxysmal atrial fibrillation]. Vestn Ross Akad Med Nauk. 2007;(4):3-9. PMID: 17561641
citations.BibTeX: @article{17561641, title={[Alternative approaches to treatment of paroxysmal atrial fibrillation].}, author={Tatarskiĭ BA}, journal={Vestn Ross Akad Med Nauk}, number={4}, pages={3-9}}

results.title: Adherence to EBM guidelines in clinical practice.
results.text_hl: In 2009 @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@ use decreased to 30%, while prescribing of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ increased from 0 in 2006 to 13.3%.

citations.NLM: Khafizianova RKh, Burykin IM. Adherence to EBM guidelines in clinical practice. Int J Risk Saf Med. 2015;27 Suppl 1():S53-4. PMID: 26639710
citations.BibTeX: @article{26639710, title={Adherence to EBM guidelines in clinical practice.}, author={Khafizianova RKh and Burykin IM}, journal={Int J Risk Saf Med}, volume={27 Suppl 1}, pages={S53-4}}
